intro: Strobilanthes monadelpha, commonly known as the white strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
